profiledesc.creation:
Machine-readable finding aid derived from automated markup system.
Date of source: September 20, 1999
Processed by Kirk White, Sandeep Mody, and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico September 20, 1999; Finding Aid encoded by Paula Jeannet Mangiafico and Lisa Stark, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University, July, 2000

change.item: PUBLIC "-//David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library//TEXT (US::NDD::::Albert Rees Papers)//EN" "rees.xml" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.xsl (sy2003-10-15).

Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. Within the dsc, dates for series were normalized. These changes were made by Michelle Belden.
Also, container TYPE and LABEL attribute values were standardized according to the Rubenstein Library EAD 2002 manual and the NCEAD eadlocal.ent by Ruth E. Bryan.
The tag list inside index was changed to indexentry by Ruth E. Bryan.

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Portions of the collection are restricted.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert Rees Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Albert Rees Papers were received as a gift to the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library in 1993.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Kirk White, Sandeep Mody, and Paula Jeannet Mangiafico
Encoded by Paula Jeannet Mangiafico and Lisa Stark
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Economics professor and administrator at Princeton University. Headed Gerald Ford's Council on Wage and Price Stability.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection contains correspondence, lectures, writings, and course notes. There is testimony involving a union dispute. Some correspondence is divided by name of correspondent.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

scopecontent.p: Access is restricted; for more details, please see the reference staff of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.
